Generate Random Samples from a Riemannian Normal Distribution

Source: R/other_utils.R
rspdnorm.Rd

Simulates random samples from a Riemannian normal distribution on symmetric positive definite matrices.# nolint: line_length_linter.

Usage

rspdnorm(n, refpt, disp, met)

Arguments

n

Number of samples to generate.

refpt

Reference point on the manifold, represented as a symmetric positive definite matrix. Must be an object of class dppMatrix from the Matrix package.# nolint: line_length_linter.

disp

Dispersion matrix defining the spread of the distribution. Must be an object of class dppMatrix from the Matrix package.# nolint: line_length_linter.

met

A metric object of class rmetric.

Value

An object of class CSample containing the generated samples.

On this page
